Research Datasets

Our lab has developed several high-quality datasets for computer vision and biometrics research.

Long-Range Person Recognition Aerial and Ground Views 18 UAV Viewpoints 120m Max Altitude 7 Collection Sites
Visit Website View Paper

DetReIDX: A Stress-Test Dataset for Real-World UAV-Based Person Recognition

A comprehensive benchmark dataset built for real-world, long-range human recognition. It supports key computer vision tasks like person detection, re-identification (ReID), multi-view tracking, and action recognition — all captured in complex outdoor scenes using drones and ground cameras.

Dataset Information

  • Year: 2025
  • Authors: Kailash Hambarde, Hugo Proença, Carolina Fernandes, Pavan Kumar MP, Nzakiese Mbongo, Satishkumar Mekewad, Gökhan SİLAHTAROĞLU, Alice A. Nithya, Pawan Wasnik, Md Rashidunnabi, Pranita Samale

Key Highlights

  • Long-Range Person Recognition
  • Aerial and Ground Views
  • 18 UAV Viewpoints
  • 120m Max Altitude
  • 7 Collection Sites
253 Identities 10+ Soft-Biometrics 2 Sessions (with appearance changes) 18 viewpoints per identity Variable altitude (20-40m)
Visit Website View Paper

P-DESTRE: Fully Annotated Datasets for Pedestrian Detection, Tracking, Re-Identification and Search from Aerial Devices

A fully annotated multi-session dataset for Pedestrian Detection, Tracking, Re-identification (REID) and Search from aerial devices. It contains data for 253 identities, over 2 sessions (clothing/appearance changes), with 18 viewpoints per identity, acquired by drones flying at various altitudes, with pitch angles and lighting conditions.

Dataset Information

  • Year: 2020
  • Authors: Aruna Kumar S. V, Ehsan Yaghoubi, Abhijit Das, B. S. Harish, Hugo Proença

Key Highlights

  • 253 Identities
  • 10+ Soft-Biometrics
  • 2 Sessions (with appearance changes)
  • 18 viewpoints per identity
  • Variable altitude (20-40m)

Intelligent Systems

The Intelligent Systems Laboratory at the University of Beira Interior focuses on computer vision, pattern recognition, and biometrics research.
